alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Page; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 10:18PM CDT until April 14 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR MONTGOMERY...NORTHEASTERN MILLS...SOUTHEASTERN POTTAWATTAMIE AND NORTH CENTRAL PAGE COUNTIES... At 1018 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Griswold to 5 miles north of Stanton to 5 miles southwest of Villisca, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 1014 PM, a 63 mph wind gust was measured at the Red Oak airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Grant. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
